May 7, 195>6
Mr. John Kriebel
106 West Highland Avenue
Langhoroe, Pennsylvania
Dear Mr. Kriebel:
In reply to your request for information about the NAFJB, I am enclosing
some brochures describing the Association’s functions and activities.
You will notice that only educational stations owned and operated on a
noncommercial basis by educational or public service institutions are
available for available for Active membership. Associate membership is
available to such institutions who do not own teismitter facilities but
regularly produce educational programs over commercial outlets* Affili¬
ate membership is open to any individual or organisation interested in
educational broadcasting. Carrier current, or wired*wireless stations
are not eligible for Active membership*
Active members pay dues, based on transmitter power, ranging from $15.
to $100. Associate and Affiliate members pay dues of 10 annually. All
of these dues include an annual subscription to our monthly Newsletter.
I do not have a greal deal of information about the use of carrier-current
stations in high schools and elementary schools, but I do believe that
some such stations are in existence. In addition several school systems,
and even individual high schools and junior high schools, operate regu¬
lar broadcasting stations, and most of these are members of our Associ¬
ation*
At the present time there are not a large number of positions open in the
educational broadcasting field, although such openings do appear with some
degree of regularity. Our Association operates a Placement Service to
information and would like to file an application with the Placement Serv¬
ice, please direct your inquiry to Mr. Robert Underwood at this same ad¬
dress.
Sincerely,
Harold S. Hill
Associate Director
